Other Information.Test Conditions: 1 M H2SO4, varying current densities from 1 to 20 A·g−1
Other Information.Additional Info: The sieving effect promotes efficient ion migration from mesopores to micropores.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 1 M TEABF4 in propylene carbonate, voltage window of 2 V
Other Information.Additional Info: The waffle-like morphology and interconnected micro/mesoporous structure facilitate electrolyte migration.

Sieving Mechanism: Promotes efficient ion migration via interconnected micro/mesoporous hierarchical structure.

Experimental Validation.Method: Electrochemical measurements (CV, GCD, Ragone plot, cycling stability tests)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Specific capacitance: 300.7 F·g−1 at 1 A·g−1; Specific energy: 27 W·h·kg−1 at 500 W·kg−1; Capacitance retention: ~85% after 10,000 cycles.

Other Information.Additional Info: WNPC exhibits a high nitrogen content (7.5 wt%) and oxygen content (9.1 wt%), contributing to pseudocapacitance and enhanced electrolyte migration due to the sieving effect.
